required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study With Lyrica In Patients Suffering From Epilepsy
clinical_study.official_title: Non-Interventional Study (NIS) With Lyrica In Patients With Epilepsy As Adjunctive Therapy Of Partial Seizures To Reduce Seizure Frequency

brief_summary.textblock: Clinical study with Lyrica (pregabalin) in patients suffering from epilepsy. This drug is used as adjunctive therapy with one or more antiepileptics. Lyrica has potential to reduce seizure frequency.

detailed_description.textblock: - Included all adult patients with partial seizures and without contraindications according to Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a 50 Percent or Greater Reduction From Baseline in 28 Day Partial Seizure Frequency
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through week 16 or early termination (ET)
primary_outcome.description: Responder rate was defined as the percentage of participants with at least a 50% reduction in 28-day partial seizure frequency from baseline during the maintenance phase (Week 4 - Week 16). The percent change in partial seizure frequency in the maintenance phase was the change from baseline in partial seizure frequency * 100, divided by the partial seizure frequency at the baseline visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in 28 Day Partial Seizure Frequency at Final Visit
secondary_outcome.description: The partial seizure frequency for the baseline period was the total number of partial seizures recorded for that period at Visit 0 (week 0). For each participant's final visit, the 28 day partial seizure frequency equals total number of partial seizures since the last visit * 28 divided by total number of days since the last visit. For percent change from baseline: change from baseline in partial seizure frequency*100 divided by partial seizure frequency at baseline visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With no Seizures (Partial or Other) During the Last 4 Weeks in the Study
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were regarded as seizure-free if no seizures (partial or other) were reported for the participant during the last 4 weeks in the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Visual Analog Scale of Anxiety (VAS-A) Scores at Week 4 and Final Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, week 4 and week 16 or ET
secondary_outcome.description: VAS-A consists of a visual analog scale ranging from, 0 mm (no anxiety) to 100 mm (extreme anxiety).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Categorical Scores on Clinical Global Impression of Severity (CGI-S)
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-S: 7-point clinician rated scale to assess severity of participant's current illness state; range: 1 (normal - not ill at all) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients). Higher score = more affected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Change in Clinical Global Impression of Severity (CGI-C) From Baseline at Final Visit
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI-C scale measures a physician's global impression of a participant's clinical condition at final visit in terms of change relative to the start of treatment (CGI-C). At final visit, the participants CGI-C will be categorized into a three point scale as: improvement: CGI response of very much improved, much improved or minimally improved; no change: CGI response of no change; worsening: CGI response of very much worse, much worse or minimally worse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Sleep Scale Sub-scores at Week 16 or ET
secondary_outcome.description: MOS: participant rated questionnaire, assess sleep quality and quantity. Consists of 9-item overall sleep problems index (length of time to fall asleep, how many hours of sleep each night during past 4 weeks); 7 subscales rated 1 (all the time) to 6 (none of the time): sleep disturbance, snoring, awaken short of breath (SOB) or with a headache, somnolence adequacy, and sleep quantity. Transformed scores (actual raw score minus lowest possible score divided by possible raw score range multiplied by 100); sub-scales total score range= 0-100; higher score indicates greater intensity of attribute.

arm_group.description: Adult patients with partial seizures (type of epilepsy). Inclusion criteria according to Summary of Product Characteristics

intervention.description: The daily dose may range from 150mg to 600mg, administered as two single doses. The treatment should be started with 150mg daily dose (2x75mg). Depending on response and tolerability after 7 days may the dose be increased to 300mg/day (2x150mg) and after further 7 days to maximum dose 600mg/day (2x300mg)

study_pop.textblock:
- Adult patiens with partial seizures.
- Other inclusion criteria according to Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients with partial seizures.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications according to Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC).

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 286 participants were assigned to treatment. At 1 of study sites, lack of archival of study files, source documentation, missing informed consent forms and large data discrepancies led to exclusion of all data from this site (N=5), as data could not be verified. Removal of these 5 participants did not change interpretation of results.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin (Lyrica) at a dose ranging from 150 milligrams (mg) to 600 mg administered as two single doses, daily until Week 16.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin (Lyrica) at a dose ranging from 150 milligrams (mg) to 600 mg administered as two single doses, daily until Week 16.

measure.title: 28-Day partial seizure frequency
measure.description: The partial seizure frequency for the baseline period was the total number of partial seizures recorded for that period at Visit 0 (week 0). This was evaluated for 264 participants.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a 50 Percent or Greater Reduction From Baseline in 28 Day Partial Seizure Frequency
outcome.description: Responder rate was defined as the percentage of participants with at least a 50% reduction in 28-day partial seizure frequency from baseline during the maintenance phase (Week 4 Week 16). The percent change in partial seizure frequency in the maintenance phase was the change from baseline in partial seizure frequency * 100, divided by the partial seizure frequency at the baseline visit.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline through week 16 or early termination (ET)
outcome.population: The modified full analysis set (MFAS) included all participants who received at least 1 dose of the study drug and who had at least one baseline seizure. Participants who discontinued during first 4 weeks titration phase were regarded as missing and were excluded from the analysis.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin (Lyrica) at a dose ranging from 150 milligrams (mg) to 600 mg administered as two single doses, daily until Week 16.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a 50 Percent or Greater Reduction From Baseline in 28 Day Partial Seizure Frequency
measure.description: Responder rate was defined as the percentage of participants with at least a 50% reduction in 28-day partial seizure frequency from baseline during the maintenance phase (Week 4 Week 16). The percent change in partial seizure frequency in the maintenance phase was the change from baseline in partial seizure frequency * 100, divided by the partial seizure frequency at the baseline visit.
measure.population: The modified full analysis set (MFAS) included all participants who received at least 1 dose of the study drug and who had at least one baseline seizure. Participants who discontinued during first 4 weeks titration phase were regarded as missing and were excluded from the analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage Change From Baseline in 28 Day Partial Seizure Frequency at Final Visit
outcome.description: The partial seizure frequency for the baseline period was the total number of partial seizures recorded for that period at Visit 0 (week 0). For each participants final visit, the 28 day partial seizure frequency equals total number of partial seizures since the last visit * 28 divided by total number of days since the last visit. For percent change from baseline: change from baseline in partial seizure frequency*100 divided by partial seizure frequency at baseline visit.
outcome.population: MFAS included all participants who received at least 1 dose of the study drug and who had at least one baseline seizure. Participants who discontinued during first 4 weeks titration phase were regarded as missing and were excluded from the analysis. Analysis was done using last observation carried forward (LOCF) method.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin (Lyrica) at a dose ranging from 150 milligrams (mg) to 600 mg administered as two single doses, daily until Week 16.

measure.title: Percentage Change From Baseline in 28 Day Partial Seizure Frequency at Final Visit
measure.description: The partial seizure frequency for the baseline period was the total number of partial seizures recorded for that period at Visit 0 (week 0). For each participants final visit, the 28 day partial seizure frequency equals total number of partial seizures since the last visit * 28 divided by total number of days since the last visit. For percent change from baseline: change from baseline in partial seizure frequency*100 divided by partial seizure frequency at baseline visit.
measure.population: MFAS included all participants who received at least 1 dose of the study drug and who had at least one baseline seizure. Participants who discontinued during first 4 weeks titration phase were regarded as missing and were excluded from the analysis. Analysis was done using last observation carried forward (LOCF) method.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With no Seizures (Partial or Other) During the Last 4 Weeks in the Study
outcome.description: Participants were regarded as seizure-free if no seizures (partial or other) were reported for the participant during the last 4 weeks in the study.
outcome.population: MFAS: Data collected during the titration phase, i.e. prior to Visit 2 (Week 4) were not analyzed for this endpoint. Only participants who did not discontinue in the first 4 weeks after the baseline visit (titration phase) and had at least 4 weeks of seizure data during the maintenance phase were analyzed for this endpoint.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin (Lyrica) at a dose ranging from 150 milligrams (mg) to 600 mg administered as two single doses, daily until Week 16.

measure.title: Number of Participants With no Seizures (Partial or Other) During the Last 4 Weeks in the Study
measure.description: Participants were regarded as seizure-free if no seizures (partial or other) were reported for the participant during the last 4 weeks in the study.
measure.population: MFAS: Data collected during the titration phase, i.e. prior to Visit 2 (Week 4) were not analyzed for this endpoint. Only participants who did not discontinue in the first 4 weeks after the baseline visit (titration phase) and had at least 4 weeks of seizure data during the maintenance phase were analyzed for this endpoint.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Visual Analog Scale of Anxiety (VAS-A) Scores at Week 4 and Final Visit
outcome.description: VAS-A consists of a visual analog scale ranging from, 0 mm (no anxiety) to 100 mm (extreme anxiety).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, week 4 and week 16 or ET
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): Included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. Participants who did not have the minimum required data for the statistical summary were treated as missing. Analysis was done using LOCF method.

measure.description: VAS-A consists of a visual analog scale ranging from, 0 mm (no anxiety) to 100 mm (extreme anxiety).
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): Included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. Participants who did not have the minimum required data for the statistical summary were treated as missing. Analysis was done using LOCF method.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Categorical Scores on Clinical Global Impression of Severity (CGI-S)
outcome.description: CGI-S: 7-point clinician rated scale to assess severity of participant's current illness state; range: 1 (normal - not ill at all) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients). Higher score = more affected.
outcome.population: FAS: Included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. Participants who did not have the minimum required data for the statistical summary were treated as missing.

measure.description: CGI-S: 7-point clinician rated scale to assess severity of participant's current illness state; range: 1 (normal - not ill at all) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients). Higher score = more affected.
measure.population: FAS: Included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. Participants who did not have the minimum required data for the statistical summary were treated as missing.

class.title: Among the most extremely ill participants

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Change in Clinical Global Impression of Severity (CGI-C) From Baseline at Final Visit
outcome.description: The CGI-C scale measures a physicians global impression of a participants clinical condition at final visit in terms of change relative to the start of treatment (CGI-C). At final visit, the participants CGI-C will be categorized into a three point scale as: improvement: CGI response of very much improved, much improved or minimally improved; no change: CGI response of no change; worsening: CGI response of very much worse, much worse or minimally worse.
outcome.population: FAS: Included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. Participants who did not have the minimum required data for the statistical summary were treated as missing.

measure.description: The CGI-C scale measures a physicians global impression of a participants clinical condition at final visit in terms of change relative to the start of treatment (CGI-C). At final visit, the participants CGI-C will be categorized into a three point scale as: improvement: CGI response of very much improved, much improved or minimally improved; no change: CGI response of no change; worsening: CGI response of very much worse, much worse or minimally worse.
measure.population: FAS: Included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. Participants who did not have the minimum required data for the statistical summary were treated as missing.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Sleep Scale Sub-scores at Week 16 or ET
outcome.description: MOS: participant rated questionnaire, assess sleep quality and quantity. Consists of 9-item overall sleep problems index (length of time to fall asleep, how many hours of sleep each night during past 4 weeks); 7 subscales rated 1 (all the time) to 6 (none of the time): sleep disturbance, snoring, awaken short of breath (SOB) or with a headache, somnolence adequacy, and sleep quantity. Transformed scores (actual raw score minus lowest possible score divided by possible raw score range multiplied by 100); sub-scales total score range= 0-100; higher score indicates greater intensity of attribute.
outcome.population: The FAS included all participants who received at least 1 dose of the study drug and had at least one efficacy measurement.

measure.description: MOS: participant rated questionnaire, assess sleep quality and quantity. Transformed scores (actual raw score minus lowest possible score divided by possible raw score range multiplied by 100); sub-scales total score range= 0-100; higher score indicates greater intensity of attribute.
measure.population: The FAS included all participants who received at least 1 dose of the study drug and had at least one efficacy measurement.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Concomitant Drug Treatments
outcome.description: Concomitant drug (any drug other than, and in addition to, the study drug) taken for any period of time during the study.
outcome.population: Safety analysis set included all enrolled participants who received 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin (Lyrica) at a dose ranging from 150 milligrams (mg) to 600 mg administered as two single doses, daily until Week 16.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Concomitant Drug Treatments
measure.description: Concomitant drug (any drug other than, and in addition to, the study drug) taken for any period of time during the study.
measure.population: Safety analysis set included all enrolled participants who received 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Concomitant Co-morbidities
outcome.description: Participants who had a concomitant co-morbidity during the study for any period of time from baseline through to Week 16 (Final Visit); participants with more than one concomitant co-morbidity were counted for each of the co-morbidity classes applicable.
outcome.population: Safety analysis set included all enrolled participants who received 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin (Lyrica) at a dose ranging from 150 milligrams (mg) to 600 mg administered as two single doses, daily until Week 16.

measure.description: Participants who had a concomitant co-morbidity during the study for any period of time from baseline through to Week 16 (Final Visit); participants with more than one concomitant co-morbidity were counted for each of the co-morbidity classes applicable.
measure.population: Safety analysis set included all enrolled participants who received 1 dose of study medication.

class.title: Psychotic disorder due to medical condition

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Pregabalin
group.description: Pregabalin (Lyrica) at a dose ranging from 150 milligrams (mg) to 600 mg administered as two single doses, daily until Week 16.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: On review of blinded data it was decided that an additional analysis set, MFAS was required. MFAS was created for analysis of seizure data. The outcomes related to seizure data were therefore analyzed for MFAS population and not FAS population.
